topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c31db66368724cf3be1900#post_54c31db66368724cf3be1900
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c31cbb636872471f950700#post_54c31cbb636872471f950700
[bq="uc9"]Same-sex marriage is now legal in Alabama.



In more controversial news the supreme court is reviewing lethal injections for death sentences.
. . Hold on folks, before the shitstorm starts let me just explain why they're reviewing it; the reason why they're reviewing the death sentence is because turns out the last bunch of death sentences they've been utterly fucking it up.  When you hear "lethal injection" you would imagine them putting the prisoner under and injecting a lethal dosage of say tranquilizers or such; straight up nah, they've been injecting non-medically approved concoctions to the point prisoners are screaming and yelling and thrashing about their bodies feeling as though they're being burned alive.

Personally I think it does need to be reviewed cause it's straight up illegal to have non-medical professionals in charge and carrying out medical procedures.[/bq]

And they have been doing this since... How many years?[/bq]
And you wonder why the supreme court is reviewing it?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c31f71636872170e3e0100#post_54c31f71636872170e3e0100
Quite a while, cause if you are a doctor and you perform a lethal injection for the state you lose your license.  There might be a possibility that the death sentence in the usa might get the axe because in order for the death sentence to be legal it has to be a lethal injection from a doctor, but if you're a doctor you'll lose your license and they've been trying to fly under the supreme court's radar for this.
